titleproper.value: Guide to Black Student Service Center Records <num>RG.39.212</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2020-01-27T15:25:52</date>

extent.value: in 2 record cartons and one oversize flat box

abstract.value: The Black Student Service Center (BSSC) at New York University was established in 1973 "to enrich the cultural, social, and educational experiences of the Black student." This collection contains the organization's records and photographs from BSSC special events.

p.value: Material pertaining to individual student records may be restricted in accordance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Please contact the Archives with specific questions regarding access to such records.
Identification of item, date (if known); Black Student Service Center Records; RG 39.212; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
Transferred from Loeb Student Center operations in 1997.
In 1985 the BSSC received the Chancellor's Service Award for Programming at NYU.

This collection contains organizational records from the Black Student Service Center at New York University. Included are correspondence, bylaws and constitutions, committee minutes, expense receipts and budgets, membership lists, publicity materials, and event photographs.

subject.value: African Americans -- Politics and government -- 20th century.
